Table.name: AGN2MASS
Table.Description: The AGN2MASS table contains candidate AGN from 2MASS red AGN survey. The programme ID number (progid in the target table) for this input catalogue is 116.

Column.name: TARGETNAME
Column.Description: matching name in TARGET table, used to name FITS files and generate thumbnail images

Table.name: DENISI
Table.Description: The DENISI table contains sources from the DENIS survey with I < 14.85. The programme ID number (progid in the target table) for this input catalogue is 6.

Column.name: TARGETNAME
Column.Description: matching name in TARGET table, used to name FITS files and generate thumbnail images

Table.name: DENISJ
Table.Description: The DENISJ table contains sources from the DENIS survey with J < 13.85. The programme ID number (progid in the target table) for this input catalogue is 5.

Column.name: TARGETNAME
Column.Description: matching name in TARGET table, used to name FITS files and generate thumbnail images

Table.name: DURUKST
Table.Description: The DURUKST table contains galaxies from the extension to the Durham/UKST galaxy survey. The programme ID number (progid in the target table) for this input catalogue is 78.

Column.name: TARGETNAME
Column.Description: matching name in TARGET table, used to name FITS files and generate thumbnail images

Table.name: FSC
Table.Description: The FSC table contains galaxies from the IRAS faint source catalogue. The programme ID number (progid in the target table) for this input catalogue is 126.

Column.name: TARGETNAME
Column.Description: matching name in TARGET table, used to name FITS files and generate thumbnail images

Table.name: HES
Table.Description: The HES table contains candidate QSOs from the Hamburg/ESO Survey. The programme ID number (progid in the target table) for this input catalogue is 129.

Column.name: TARGETNAME
Column.Description: matching name in TARGET table, used to name FITS files and generate thumbnail images

Table.name: HIPASS
Table.Description: The HIPASS table contains candidate galaxies from the HIPASS survey in HI. The programme ID number (progid in the target table) for this input catalogue is 119.

Column.name: TARGETNAME
Column.Description: matching name in TARGET table, used to name FITS files and generate thumbnail images

Table.name: NVSS
Table.Description: The NVSS table contains candidate QSOs from NVSS. The programme ID number (progid in the target table) for this input catalogue is 130.

Column.name: TARGETNAME
Column.Description: matching name in TARGET table, used to name FITS files and generate thumbnail images

Table.name: RASS
Table.Description: The RASS table contains candidate QSO/AGN from the ROSAT All-Sky Survey. The programme ID number (progid in the target table) for this input catalogue is 113.

Column.name: TARGETNAME
Column.Description: matching name in TARGET table, used to name FITS files and generate thumbnail images

Table.name: shapley
Table.Description: The SHAPLEY table contains galaxies from the Shapely supercluster region. The programme ID number (progid in the target table) for this input catalogue is 90.

Column.name: TARGETNAME
Column.Description: matching name in TARGET table, used to name FITS files and generate thumbnail images

Table.name: SPECTRA
Table.Description: The SPECTRA table holds all the observational and redshift related data. Parameters are recorded for both the V and R frames (with a lot of the values being the same for both frames), redshift information is derived from a combined VR frame. Objects can be observed more than once.

Table.name: SUMSS
Table.Description: The SUMSS table contains bright radio sources from SUMSS. The programme ID number (progid in the target table) for this input catalogue is 125.

Column.name: TARGETNAME
Column.Description: matching name in TARGET table, used to name FITS files and generate thumbnail images

Table.name: SUPERCOS
Table.Description: The SUPERCOS table contains galaxies selected from SuperCOSMOS scans of UKST plates. This table contains galaxies at |b| > 20 with Bj < 16.75 or R < 15.6. The programme ID numbers (progid in the target table) for the Bj and R selected surveys are 8 and 7 respectively.

Column.name: TARGETNAME
Column.Description: matching name in TARGET table, used to name FITS files and generate thumbnail images

Column.name: MAG_1
Column.Description: Bj mag, SCOS bright galaxy calibration

Column.name: MAG_2
Column.Description: R mag, SCOS bright galaxy calibration

Table.name: TARGET
Table.Description:
The TARGET table represents the master target list used to configure 6dFGS observations. This list was formed by merging all the survey input tables/catalogues. TARGET is the hub of the database.
The record with targetid=0 and targetname='blank____record' is there for objects that appear in other tables that for some reason are no longer in the master TARGET configuration file. eg there are some 70 objects in SPECTRA that are not in TARGET, they have been assigned a targetid=0 in the SPECTRA table.

Column.name: TARGETID
Column.Description: Unique ID used to link tables

Column.name: TARGETNAME
Column.Description: name in config file, used to name FITS file and generate thumbnail images

Table.name: TWOMASS
Table.Description: The TWOMASS table contains holds the K, J and H selected samples originating from the 2MASS extended source catalogue. The K-selected sample, K < 12.75 represents the primary 6dFGS input catalogue. The H and J selected samples reach H < 13.00 and J < 13.75. The programme ID numbers (progid in the target table) for the K, H and J selected surveys are 1, 3 and 4 respectively.

Column.name: TARGETNAME
Column.Description: matching name in TARGET table, used to name FITS files and generate thumbnail images
